title.narrative: Saving the life of vulnerable population through the provision of WASH facilities, child protection and psychosocial assistance.

description.narrative:
The proposed intervention is shaped based on the relevant outcomes, outputs, indicators and outputs of WASH and Protection (CPiE) Clusters, stated under 1st and 2nd strategic objective of Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP) for 2018. Through proposed project an immediate assistance will be provided to the families affected by drought in Southern Afghanistan. The proposed aid will be targeting both – drought affected IDPs and host communities.
The Project title is – Saving the life of vulnerable population through the provision of WASH facilities, child protection and psychosocial assistance.
Overall Objective of the project – To enhance well-being and restore dignity of drought affected families through WASH services, provision of psychosocial support and strengthening of CPiE mechanism by formation of Child Friendly Spaces in hard to reach districts of Hilmand and Kandahar provinces.
Project target locations: 7 hard to reach districts in four southern provinces as follows: Kandahar – Zahrey, Nesh and Maywand districts. Hilmand – Deh-e-Shu, Nad-e-Ali, Nawzad, Reg-i-Khan Nishin.
The project is ensuring timely access to a sufficient quantity of safe drinking water via meaningful access to strategic boreholes and water trucks as well as the families displaced due to drought will receive Hygiene Kits, the water will be supplied once a day to target location, the water quantity will be based on sphere standards. The target population will also receive community based hygiene and sanitation promotion sessions.
Under the protection component of the project, for the purpose of immediate protection, 18 safe spaces will be formed for high-risky children protecting them from violence, abuse, exploitation, reducing protection threats and providing them psychosocial needs, recreational activities reviving children’s life from distress towards peace and relief and inspiring into them that the adverse conditions of life can get normal back. In addition, the provision of psychosocial assistance to drought affected men, women, boys and girls will enhance their psychosocial well-being, relief from harmful, stressful and critical situation or environment resulted due to drought.
All activities of the project are framed in a way to be in coordination with relevant clusters, stakeholder, line departments and target communities as well as contribute to the well-being of target individuals without any gender, ethnic, tribal, etc. discrimination.
The overall beneficiaries will be 52260 and the breakdown is as follows:
- 42000 individuals will receive potable water. - 1200 male and female will receive hygiene promotion session. - 4200 beneficiaries displaced due to drought, will benefit from hygiene kits. - 1260 children will be accommodated in 18 CFSs. - 3600 male and female will received psychosocial assistance.
